places_with_reviews.name: Bhadranag Temple
places_with_reviews.address: 34W7+Q4C, Main Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Ramnagar, Bhadravati, Maharashtra 442902, India

reviews.text: Feeling blessed in the presence of divine architecture at Bhadranaag mandir @Bhadravati

Worship place for Shiva. Old persons from this area says, There was big Snake which always stays there, and people worship him also. Good worship place with ample parking. Now a days Mahaprasad also started there and timings are from 12:30 PM everyday.

Temple situated in Bhadravati in Maharashtra. It's takes 2:30 hrs from Nagpur which is of 130 km roughly. Temple has Strong history..but not satisfactory review from people because of modernization of temples. Old is gold 🥇🪙
Gram devata of Bhandak, peaceful and auspicious

Very religious and power place

Cleanliness was above high

Good area for parking

places_with_reviews.name: Vijasan Caves
places_with_reviews.address: Vijasan, Road, Vinjasan, Bhadravati, Maharashtra 442902, India

reviews.text: One of the best ancient rock cut caves. Situated very nere to nagpur chandrapur highway in Bhadravati  town. The historical place has grate value. Very admirable work of our ancestors. It is one of the best buddhist Leni in Vidarbha region. You don't need too much time to stop here. Parking has no issues. You must have your food with you. Kids have no problem.
Similar type of cave you will find in the Barabar Hills at Rajgir,Bihar.That cave was built by Asoka the Great very well polished from inside and has Pali inscriptions too....

If you are around Bhadravati you can visit this place, there are few interesting places here to visit  and  this is one amongst it. Its a buddhist cave and i understand it must be meditation center for buddist as you have small seats built inside the cave where they must have used to meditate or practice there spiritual journey. The place is very peaceful. lord Buddha and lord Mahavir's statue has been carved on the rocks its beautiful but have gone little old. You asked not to wear shoes inside and not to click photos.  We did meditate for sometime to feel the positive energy around us in the cave. Once you are done you can climb the cave from outside its just like 10-15 mins simple trekking where once u reach top you get a good view of the city plus cool breeze.
A good place to visit, more of its a small hill with some caves inside, a great place to watch a sunset from the top.

Very best place i ever seen before that place was very cool,and cleaness is most wondering, everyone should go there it's a buddhist cave where lord buddha sitting in meditation posture,it was very peaceful .

places_with_reviews.name: Bhadravati Fort
places_with_reviews.address: vitthal mandir, near killa, Bazar Ward, Ekta Nagar, Bhadravati, Maharashtra 442902, India

reviews.text:
This old fort is rather small and has lost a lot of its original structures. There is a well, and a staircase that leads to it, which the caretaker told us was the snan grah (bathing place) of Rani Bhadravati. There are a lot of sculptures, which seem to have been defaced or else have broken down due to old age. There is a gate structure remaining to the main compound of the fort.

The paths leading to the fort are rather narrow and can be difficult for a car. There are no entry fees and no facilities at this place.

This fort is situated in the heart of the city. Getting there is a bit difficult by car but not impossible. Roads are too narrow. A must see place if you like historical monuments.
For many years this was unattended and most of it's structure has been demolished. There remains a gate, deep well, some few demolished room structures and huge boundary wall on all 4 sides.
This fort has some caretakers who can guide you about the remains. It is open to visitors from 8.30 am to 5.30 pm all days.
Now the local authorities have cleared up this place and looks better.
Recommend to go there with your shoes as there are large stairs and slippery on a rainy day.

Nice place having cultural background...
Enjoyed to visit..
Good historical fort, but you won't find any guide there only the board putup by the ASI

Brilliant piece of monument, should be taken care of. Looks like it has less attention from the government. These moments should be preserved.
The ambiance is amazing. You will find peace here amidst the chaos

A must see place if you like to see historical places.
